channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gold Rises After Fed's Go-to Inflation Measure Was Lighter Than Expected
item.description: Gold prices extended gains after the latest U.S. data showed PCE inflation rose less than expected. The metal is still poised for a modest weekly loss...

item.title: Trump media stock ‘DJT’ drops as president-elect moves entire $4 billion stake to revocable trust
item.description: Trump Media & Technology Group Corp.’s stock fell about 6% Friday after Donald J. Trump transferred his entire $4 billion stake in the company into a ...

item.title: Biden pulls the plug on mass student-debt cancellation after rushing $4.28 billion in relief
item.description: Tens of thousands of public servants will have $4.28 billion in student debt canceled, the Biden administration announced Friday.

item.title: Meme stocks were fueled by Roaring Kitty and ‘Trump trades’ this year. What can we expect in 2025?
item.description: The return to social media of Keith Gill, also known as Roaring Kitty, thrust original meme stocks AMC and GameStop back into the spotlight in 2024.

item.title: Euro Likely to Weaken to Parity Against Dollar in 2025
item.description: The euro was higher against the dollar. Danske Bank’s analysts expect the euro to decline towards parity against the dollar over a 12-month horizon gi...

item.title: Oil Demand Concerns Weigh on 2025 Price Outlook
item.description: Brent crude is expected to average $71.57 a barrel next year, while West Texas Intermediate is seen at $67.44 a barrel. Global oil demand growth slowe...

item.title: Dow Rebounds But Still on Course for Worst Week Since March 2023
item.description: Stocks came roaring back, but the gains won’t prevent major U.S. indexes from ending the week lower.

item.title: More than $125 million is stolen every year on Zelle. The feds say little is done to stop it.
item.description: A lawsuit filed by the CFPB says Zelle and the big banks that own it left the platform vulnerable to fraud in an effort to rush it to market to compet...

item.title: Forget the 4% rule. Consider this new magic number for retirement withdrawals instead.
item.description: The economy and your own spending should drive what you take out of your retirement investments, new research says.

item.title: You're Invited to Wall Street's Private Party. Say You're Busy.
item.description: Small-time investors may soon gain easier access to so-called private markets. That usually means higher fees, greater risk, more conflicts of interes...
